snippet: The Metropolitan Transportation Authority is adding a surcharge for the purchase of a new card, a move that transit officials predict will lead riders to refill their existing passes.
abstract: Metropolitan Transportation Authority will begin charging $1 for purchase of new Metrocard, move that transit officials hope will push riders to refill existing passes rather than discarding them when they are empty; surcharge may generate $20 million profit as well as cut down on litter in subway stations.
lead_paragraph: The Metropolitan Transportation Authority is adding a surcharge for the purchase of a new card, a move that transit officials predict will lead riders to refill their existing passes.

headline.seo: New MetroCards to Cost $1 Starting Sunday
headline.main: Save That MetroCard! A New One Will Now Cost $1
